macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Decline on Bank Earnings Disappointment and Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.5% to 6,926, Dow Jones dropped 0.09% to 49,149, and Nasdaq Composite slumped 1% to 23,471 on January 14, pressured by weak bank results from Citigroup and Wells Fargo, alongside rising oil prices due to Iran tensions.

items.title: S&P 500 Futures Flat Ahead of Inflation Data and More Bank Earnings
items.summary: US stock futures traded flat to lower on January 14 as markets awaited inflation data, bank earnings, and grappled with Fed independence concerns amid political pressure; energy stocks rose with oil up over 2% on Iran risks.

items.title: Trump's Attacks on Fed Chair Powell Spark Central Bank Independence Fears
items.summary: Markets uneasy over President Trump's renewed criticism of Fed Chair Jerome Powell and threats to central bank independence, overshadowing softer core CPI data; global central bankers defended the Fed publicly.

items.title: Mixed Economic Data: JOLTS Shows Cooling Labor Demand, ISM Services Beats Expectations
items.summary: JOLTS data indicated a sharp drop in job openings signaling cooling labor market, while ADP private hiring rebounded modestly and ISM Services PMI surprised positively to the upside.

items.title: Tech Stocks Sink on China Chip Ban Reports Targeting Nvidia
items.summary: Tech sector weakened amid reports of China banning Nvidia's H200 AI chips, contributing to Nasdaq's 1% decline; Alphabet rallied 2.5% providing some support.

items.title: Oil Prices Surge Over 2.5% on Escalating Iran Tensions
items.summary: Crude oil jumped more than 2.5% after Trump halted engagement with Iran and supported protests, raising supply disruption fears; WTI settled up 1.4% at $62.02.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Cognizant Releases 'New Work, New World 2026' Report: AI Could Unlock $4.5 Trillion in U.S. Labor Productivity
items.summary: Cognizant's latest report reveals AI is accelerating faster than projected, potentially impacting 93% of U.S. jobs today and handling $4.5 trillion in tasks, with exposure scores 30% higher than 2032 forecasts and rising 9% annually.

items.title: Gartner Forecasts Global AI Spending to Reach $2.5 Trillion in 2026
items.summary: Gartner predicts worldwide AI spending will hit $2.52 trillion this year, up 44% year-over-year, driven by AI infrastructure (49% increase) and a shift toward proven outcomes amid the 'Trough of Disillusionment'.

items.title: Agentic AI Set for Progress in 2026 If CIOs Address Trust and Integration Challenges
items.summary: Experts highlight hype and failures in AI agents last year, with Gartner predicting 40% of projects canceled by 2027 due to costs and risks; success depends on focusing on predictable workflows and outcomes.

items.title: Global AI Selected by Major European Energy Firm for Agentic AI Platform Deployment
items.summary: A major European energy and utilities company has chosen Global AI to deploy an agentic AI platform, marking a key enterprise adoption in the sector.

items.title: World Economic Forum: AI Bubble Overblown, Capabilities Ahead of Projections
items.summary: New Cognizant research counters AI bubble fears, showing AI's rapid progress with exposure scores 30% above decade-long forecasts and 9% annual growth, potentially adding $1 trillion to U.S. GDP.

items.title: Brookings Study: Teachers Warn AI Causes 'Brainrot' and Cheating in Schools
items.summary: A Brookings report highlights concerns from educators that AI is leading to cognitive decline, reduced mastery in reading and writing, and increased cheating among high school students.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Discord's Potential IPO Signals Major Shift for Gaming Communication
items.summary: Discord is considering an initial public offering, which could significantly impact its business model and the broader video game industry reliant on its platform for community and multiplayer features.

items.title: Tencent Shares Plunge $50 Billion on China's New Gaming Spending Restrictions
items.summary: China's National Press and Publication Administration issued draft rules limiting in-game spending, banning inducements like daily login rewards, causing Tencent to lose $50 billion in market value and NetEase $13.6 billion.

items.title: Rockstar Games Launches Official Mod Marketplace
items.summary: Rockstar Games has introduced an official marketplace for mods, providing a sanctioned platform for community-created content in its titles like Grand Theft Auto.

items.title: Nioh 3 Announced at PlayStation State of Play, Playable Immediately
items.summary: Team Ninja and Koei Tecmo revealed Nioh 3 during Sony’s June State of Play showcase, allowing soulslike fans to play it right away.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Reveals Full June 2025 Wave 1 Lineup
items.summary: Microsoft confirmed the complete list of games joining Xbox Game Pass in the first wave of June 2025 ahead of the Xbox Games Showcase.

items.title: ARC Raiders Surpasses 12.4 Million Units Sold
items.summary: Nexon's ARC Raiders from Embark Studios has sold over 12.4 million units with 960,000 concurrent players ten weeks after its October 30, 2025 launch.

items.title: Capcom Announces Resident Evil Showcase for January 15, 2026
items.summary: Capcom revealed a Resident Evil Showcase event scheduled for today, January 15, 2026, promising updates on the horror franchise.

items.title: Ubisoft Faces Criticism After Halifax Studio Closure and Layoffs
items.summary: Halifax union criticized Ubisoft's first talks post-closure as offering nothing, amid confirmations of layoffs at its Abu Dhabi studio.

items.title: Neurable and HyperX Brain-Tracking Gaming Headset Wins CES 2026 Awards
items.summary: The collaborative brain-computer interface gaming headset from Neurable and HyperX earned top honors at CES 2026 for enhancing focus and performance.

items.title: No More Heroes Developer Reveals New Ultraviolent Sci-Fi Game
items.summary: Suda51 and Grasshopper Manufacture announced a new action game blending No More Heroes style with Dead Rising vibes.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Etched Raises $500M to Challenge Nvidia in AI Inference Chips
items.summary: AI chip startup Etched secured about $500 million in funding to develop specialized inference hardware for running AI models at scale, highlighting investor interest in Nvidia alternatives amid shifting demand from training to production inference.

items.title: Deepgram Raises $130M at $1.3B Valuation for Voice AI Expansion
items.summary: Voice AI startup Deepgram raised $130 million at a $1.3 billion valuation to expand internationally, develop new models, and pursue acquisitions, underscoring voice as a key interface for enterprise workflows.

items.title: Haiqu Secures $11M for Hardware-Aware Quantum Operating System
items.summary: Quantum software startup Haiqu raised $11 million to build a hardware-aware software stack optimizing near-term quantum applications under hardware constraints.

items.title: Silicon Valley Tech Giants Join Trump's 'Tech Force' Initiative
items.summary: Over 20 major tech companies including Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Apple, Oracle, Nvidia, and Palantir are partnering with the Trump administration's Tech Force program to place technologists in government roles for national challenges.

items.title: Wall Street Slumps as Tech Stocks Like Nvidia and Broadcom Fall
items.summary: Tech stocks weighed heavily on Wall Street with Nvidia down 1.4% and Broadcom sinking 4.2%, pulling the Nasdaq lower amid profit-taking after AI-driven gains made valuations expensive.

items.title: Fintech Firms Shift Investments to Energy Infrastructure for Data Centers
items.summary: Financial institutions are prioritizing energy infrastructure investments for AI data centers in 2026, diversifying portfolios away from big tech.

items.title: Investors Rotate Out of Tech Stocks into Cyclicals
items.summary: Investors are shifting from tech stocks to cyclical plays, with traders eyeing TSMC earnings amid market rotations.
